hypotheses.prediction: IF reconstituted VDAC1 in planar lipid bilayers is exposed to sinusoidal Ca²⁺ waveforms (0.1–10 Hz, amplitude 0.1–10 µM), THEN single-channel open probability (Po) will oscillate in phase with Ca²⁺ at ≤1 Hz (coherence >0.7) but lose phase-locking at >5 Hz (coherence <0.3), with the channel adopting a time-averaged intermediate conductance (~60% of full open state).
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Reconstitute purified human VDAC1 into DPhPC planar bilayers. Use a piezo-driven perfusion system (Bhatt et al. rapid-exchange method) to deliver defined Ca²⁺ waveforms (0.1, 0.5, 1, 2, 5, 10 Hz; 1 µM peak) while recording single-channel currents at ±30 mV with Axopatch 200B. Analyze Po power spectra and stimulus-response coherence. Timeline: 8 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Po power spectrum shows peak at stimulus frequency for ≤1 Hz; peak disappears at >5 Hz with Po converging to ~0.5–0.6. Metabolite flux (measured by ATP/ADP transport in vesicle assays) shows pulsatile release at 0.5 Hz but steady-state at 10 Hz.
hypotheses.null_outcome: No frequency-dependent difference in coherence; VDAC1 gating is Ca²⁺-insensitive or tracks all frequencies equally. Alternatively, no gating response to Ca²⁺ at any frequency.
readouts: ATP flux (luciferase assay in vesicle system)

hypotheses.prediction: IF isolated mitochondria are exposed to Ca²⁺ pulses of identical total integral (e.g., 50 µM·s) but different frequencies (0.2 Hz vs. 2 Hz vs. constant), THEN the 2 Hz
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Isolate liver/HeLa mitochondria by differential centrifugation. Deliver Ca²⁺ pulses via microinjector into respiring mitochondria (succinate + rotenone) at 0.2, 0.5, 1, 2, 5 Hz, matched for total Ca²⁺ integral (50 µM·s). Monitor matrix Ca²⁺ (Rhod-2 AM), membrane potential (TMRM). After 10-min protocols, cross-link with EGS, run BN-PAGE and SDS-PAGE for VDAC1 oligomers (anti-VDAC1 ab), and ELISA for cytochrome c in supernatant. Include ±CGP-37157 (NCLX inhibitor) and ±CsA (mPTP inhibitor). Timeline: 10 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: At matched integral, 2 Hz produces progressive matrix Ca²⁺ elevation (staircase pattern, final >20 µM) while 0.2 Hz allows full efflux between pulses (sawtooth, final <5 µM). VDAC1 oligomer:monomer ratio increases sharply above ~1–2 Hz. CGP-37157 shifts threshold leftward (oligomerization at lower frequencies). CsA blocks oligomerization at all frequencies.
hypotheses.null_outcome: Oligomerization depends only on total Ca²⁺ integral regardless of frequency. Matrix Ca²⁺ returns to baseline between pulses at all frequencies. No frequency threshold exists.

hypotheses.prediction: IF cytosolic Ca²⁺ oscillations are delivered at varying frequencies (0.1–10 Hz) to intact cells expressing genetically encoded Ca²⁺ indicators in cytosol, IMS, and matrix, THEN IMS [Ca²⁺] will track cytosolic oscillations near-linearly (gain ~0.8 at 0.5 Hz), but matrix [Ca²⁺] will show nonlinear bandpass behavior: attenuated at <0.1 Hz (efflux-dominated) and >3 Hz (MCU cannot activate between pulses), with peak transmission at 0.3–1 Hz, where IMS microdomains transiently exceed MCU Kd (~10–20 µM).
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: HeLa cells co-expressing CEPIA3mt (matrix), LAR-GECO1.2-IMS (IMS-targeted), and jRCaMP1b (cytosol). Drive Ca²⁺ oscillations using OptoSTIM1 (blue light-activated STIM1) at defined frequencies (0.05, 0.1, 0.3, 0.5, 1, 3, 5, 10 Hz). Image all three compartments simultaneously with spinning-disk confocal at 20 Hz. Repeat ±VDAC1 knockdown (siRNA), ±MCU knockdown (siRNA), ±Ru360, ±VBIT-4 (VDAC1 oligomerization inhibitor). Compute transfer functions (cytosol→IMS, IMS→matrix) at each frequency. Timeline: 14 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Cytosol→IMS transfer function is relatively flat (low-pass, cutoff ~5 Hz). IMS→matrix transfer function shows bandpass: gain peaks at 0.3–1 Hz, drops at <0.1 Hz and >3 Hz. MCU knockdown abolishes matrix uptake at all frequencies. VDAC1 knockdown reduces IMS peak [Ca²⁺] below MCU threshold, collapsing matrix uptake. VBIT-4 has minimal effect on Ca²⁺ transfer (affects oligomerization, not conductance).
hypotheses.null_outcome: Matrix Ca²⁺ tracks cytosolic oscillations linearly at all frequencies (no bandpass). IMS [Ca²⁺] never exceeds MCU Kd. VDAC1 knockdown has no effect on IMS Ca²⁺ dynamics.
